summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell, detailing the production of discovery materials. The materials include search warrant returns and data from electronic devices, including an iPhone seized from Jeffrey Epstein at the time of his arrest in 2019. The letter outlines the government's ongoing discovery obligations and includes a chart listing numerous subject devices and their production status.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Law enforcement seized an iPhone from Jeffrey Epstein at the time of his arrest.

events.title: Initial Discovery Production
events.description: The government produced an initial set of responsive materials from seized electronic devices to the defense.

events.title: Supplemental Discovery Production
events.description: The government produced additional discovery materials, including a hard drive and CD containing search warrant returns and data from devices, to the defense.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the case, governing the handling of confidential discovery materials.

keyFacts: Discovery materials produced include data from an iPhone (Subject Device-2) seized from Jeffrey Epstein at the time of his arrest in 2019.
The production consists of search warrant returns (SDNY_PROD015 parts 1-7 and SDNY_PROD016) and data from over 60 subject devices, many of which were produced on November 9 and 18, 2020.
The letter confirms the government's ongoing discovery obligations in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (MN)).
A chart details 62 subject devices searched pursuant to warrants, indicating which had responsive material produced and which did not.
The materials are governed by a protective order dated July 31, 2020, and the letter itself is designated as confidential.
